author: Special Correspondent
text:
A book on photo archives in the French Institute of Pondicherry and the role it played in unravelling the intricate network of idol thefts will be released during the visit of French President François Hollande to India on January 25 on the occasion of the Republic Day.

The book Shadows of Gods: An Archive and its Images retraces how the unfolding of events — from the initial idol thefts at the Brihadeeswarar temple, Sripuranthan and the Sri Varadaraja Perumal temple in the village of Suthamalli, to how the statues eventually made their way to the foremost art galleries around the world, through the vast and elaborate network set up by suspected art smuggler Subhash Chandra Kapoor.

The role that the French Institute of Pondicherry played in unravelling this intricate network is at the very heart of this book.It was the photographic evidence from this archive that led to the arrest of Kapoor, one of the most high-profile among suspected smuggling operatives.

Gopinath Sricandane, a photographer, designer and writer based in Puducherry has authored the book.

IFP Director Pierre Grard said: “ Shadows of Gods , jointly published by the French Institute of Pondicherry and the French School of Asian Studies, illustrates the expertise of this Institute and its involvement in the study and promotion of the historical and cultural heritage of India.”
title: Hollande to release book on IFP
